article.title: Computed Axial Lithography (CAL): Toward Single Step 3D Printing of Arbitrary Geometries

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following image processing techniques produces a reconstructed image with good shape but impractically low contrast? **(Figure 3)**
choices: Setting negatives in the backprojection to zero
Adding an offset to the backprojection
Emphasizing low frequencies in the backprojection

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the relationship between angular sampling and image formation quality in Computed Axial Lithography (CAL)? **(Figure 6)**
choices: Increasing the number of angular samples always improves image quality.
Decreasing the number of angular samples always improves image convergence speed.
There is an optimal angular sampling density for a given image size and resolution.
Angular sampling has no significant impact on the final image quality in CAL.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure demonstrates that the curing behavior of the resin is primarily determined by: **(Figure 9)**
According to Equation 7, which factor significantly influences the degree of cure (DOC) in a photopolymerization process besides exposure time? **(Equation 7)**
